description: Entity that lives in the Tower of Victory in Chitor.
name: Á Bao A Qu

description: Spirit that takes the form of a bull.
name: Aatxe

description: Demons that have teeth of iron.
name: Abaasy

description: Small type of unicorn reported to live in the lands of the African Congo.
name: Abada

description: Creature from a mountain pass in Kumamoto Prefecture.
name: Abura-sumashi

description: Giant birds that understand human languages.
name: Adar Llwch Gwin

description: Lake monster (exact lake varies by story).
name: Afanc

description: Ice spirit that aids hunters and fishermen.
name: Agloolik

description: Anthropophagous humanoid with eyes in its instep.
name: Aigamuxa

description: Giant turtle that supports the world.
name: Akupara

description: Spirit that steals unborn babies and livers from pregnant women.
name: Al

description: Winged humanoid that steals reproductive waste to make children.
name: Alan

description: Bird that eats gold and silver.
name: Alicanto

description: Winged unicorn from the Latin "ala" (wing) and "corn" (horn).
name: Alicorn

description: Angelic bird with human head and breasts.
name: Alkonost

description: Lion-like creature, sometimes with dragon or goat forelegs.
name: Alphyn

description: Guard dog of the Seven Sleepers.
name: Al Rakim

description: Giant who holds up the world.
name: Amala

description: Female demon with a body that was part lion, hippopotamus and crocodile.
name: Ammit

description: Tennyo from the island of Amami Ōshima.
name: Amorōnagu

description: Serpent with a head at each end.
name: Amphisbaena

description: From the Greek ángelos, divine beings of Heaven who act as mediators between God and humans; the counterparts of Demons.
name: Angel

description: Skeletal grave watcher with a lantern and a scythe.
name: Ankou

description: Ritual disciplinary demon from Iwate Prefecture.
name: Anmo

description: Giant who was extremely strong as long as he remained in contact with the ground.
name: Antaeus

description: Fish-human hybrid that attends the god Enki.
name: Apkallu

description: Extremely swift horse with a green mane and the power of speech.
name: Arion

description: Humanoid sustained by pleasant smells instead of food.
name: Astomi

description: Sea serpent that travels over boats in an arc while dripping oil.
name: Ayakashi

description: Spirit that washes azuki beans along riversides.
name: Azukiarai

description: Spirit that washes azuki beans along riversides.
name: Azukitogi

description: Soul of the deceased, depicted as a bird or a human-headed bird.
name: Ba

description: Talking beast which handed down knowledge on harmful spirits
name: Bai Ze

description: Ghostly whale skeleton that drifts along the coastline of Shimane Prefecture
name: Bake-kujira

description: Beautiful vampiric seductresses who prey on young travelers
name: Baobhan Sith

description: Powerful, evil winged man whose soul is not held by his body and can be subdued only by causing him to suffer dehydration
name: BasCelik

description: Death spirit; a type of Banshee/Bean Sídhe)
name: Bean Nighe

description: Massive beast, possibly like a dinosaur or crocodile
name: Behemoth

description: Heron-like, regenerative bird, equivalent to (or inspiration for) the Phoenix
name: Bennu

description: Mountain giants who live alongside the Hrimthursar (lit. "Rime-Giants") in Jotunheim
name: Bergrisar

description: Invisible spirit which follows people at night, making the sound of footsteps
name: Betobeto-san

description: Ghost of someone killed by execution or suicide
name: Bhūta

description: Norfolk, Essex, and Suffolk black dog
name: Black Shuck

description: Headless humanoid with face in torso
name: Blemmyae

description: Vampire-like creature that steals energy from sleeping victims
name: Boo Hag

description: Nocturnal bird that drains goats of their milk
name: Broxa

description: Ghosts/devils riding flying goats; co-opted by bandits to instil fear during raids
name: Bokkenrijders

description: Extremely ugly, but kind, forest spirit
name: Bugul Noz

description: Spirit that seduces and kills men
name: Bush Dai Dai

description: Cow-sized dog-goat hybrid in two varieties: benevolent and white; malevolent and black
name: Cadejo

description: White bird that can foretell if a sick person will recover or die
name: Caladrius

description: Apes who always bear twins, one the mother loves, the other it hates
name: Callitrix

description: Offspring of a human and an incubus or succubus; general term for any kind of human/demon hybrid
name: Cambion

description: Bird that ate the heads of the first men
name: Camulatz

description: Death spirit (a particular type of Banshee/Bean Sídhe)
name: Caoineag

description: Small creature with a jewel on its head
name: Carbuncle

description: Three-headed dog that guards the entrance to the underworld
name: Cerberus

description: Apes who always bear twins, one the mother loves, the other it hates
name: Cericopithicus

description: Hind with golden antlers and bronze or brass hooves
name: Ceryneian Hind

description: Humanoid child (fairy, elf, troll, etc.) substituted for a kidnapped human child
name: Changeling

description: Sea monster in the form of a giant mouth
name: Charybdis

description: Ancestral spirit that instructs tribe members
name: Chepi

description: Ghost of an improperly buried person
name: Chibaiskweda

description: Human-faced cow that feeds on good women
name: Chichevache

description: Hyena in Tumbuka (an ethnic group living in Malawi, Zambia and Tanzania) mythology
name: Chimbwe

description: Vengeful ghost that causes dust devils
name: Chindi

description: Temple-guarding feline, similar to Chinese Shi and Japanese Shisa
name: Chinthe

description: Ghost of a woman that died in childbirth
name: Choorile

description: Son of the gorgon Medusa, imaged as a giant or a winged boar
name: Chrysaor

description: Giant turtle that supports the world
name: Chukwa

description: Cryptid beast, named for its habit of sucking the blood of goats and other livestock
name: Chupacabra

description: Ghost of women that died in childbirth
name: Cihuateteo

description: Giant bird that makes its nest out of cinnamon
name: Cinnamon bird

description: Leprechaun-like Little people that are permanently drunk
name: Cluricaun

description: Rat-bird hybrid that can shapeshift into a serpent
name: Colo Colo

description: Little people and smith and healing spirits
name: Dactyl

cultural_origins: France, Switzerland and the north of Italy
description: Like a deer or ibex with legs on one side of its body are shorter than on the other side
name: Dahu

description: Giant responsible for creating many geographical features in Japan
name: Daidarabotchi

description: Most powerful class of tengu, each of whom lives on a separate mountain
name: Daitengu

description: Old woman who steals clothes from the souls of the dead.
name: Datsue-ba

description: Human tribe turned into apes for ignoring Moses' message.
name: Dead Sea Apes

description: Preternatural or supernatural possibly immortal being.
name: Deity

description: From the Greek daímon, chthonic entities of Hell often seen as Satan's minions who are inimical to mankind; the counterparts of Angels.
name: Demon

description: Male ancestral spirits; the Dark Elves.
name: Dökkálfar

description: Restless ghost of an unbaptised child.
name: Drekavac

description: Large carnivorous koala that hunts by dropping on its prey from trees.
name: Drop Bear

description: Little people, some are house spirits, others nature spirits.
name: Duwende

description: Spirit (sometimes the soul of a wicked deceased) that possesses the living.
name: Dybbuk

description: Diminutive humanoids, possibly inspired by Homo floresiensis
name: Ebu Gogo

description: Remora, said to attach to ships to slow them down
name: Echeneis

description: Ghosts of those not buried properly
name: Edimmu

description: Humanoid that carries a magical mat
name: Egbere

description: Hags with awls in their elbows
name: Elbow Witch

description: the Fire Giants who reside in Muspelheim, with Surtr as their leader
name: Eldjötnar

description: Personification of one of the Classical elements
name: Elemental

description: Monarch flycatcher spirit that guides canoe-builders to the proper trees
name: ‘Elepaio

description: Little people and malevolent nature spirits
name: Eloko

description: Child that can move back and forth between the material world and the afterlife at will
name: Emere

description: Female demon that waylays travelers and seduces and kills men
name: Empusa

description: Kappa of Shikoku and western Honshū
name: Enkō

description: Possibly winged spirits of vengeance or justice. Also known as Furies.
name: Erinyes

description: Dwarf who was cursed and turned into a Dragon. Later slain by Sigurd in the Saga of Nibelung.
name: Fafnir

description: Little people that constantly play pranks
name: Far darrig

description: Chinese Phoenix, female in marriage symbol
name: Fenghuang

description: Fish-human hybrid that kidnaps humans for servants
name: Finfolk

description: Giant, red cattle with swiveling horns
name: Forest Bull

description: Ghosts of people who drowned at sea
name: Funayūrei

description: Woman with a second mouth on the back of her head
name: Futakuchi-onna

description: Bird with iron beak and copper talons
name: Gagana

description: Male fairy that seduces human women
name: Gancanagh

description: Male nature spirits, often depicted as part human, part animal
name: Gandharva

description: Spirit that protects a specific place
name: Genius loci

description: Male spirit associated with bringing rain and hail
name: German

description: Giant with three heads, six arms, three torsos and (in some sources) six legs
name: Geryon

description: Disembodied spirits, specifically of those that have died
name: Ghost

description: Earth genie. Also a shape shifting desert anthropophagus, often classified as undead.
name: Ghoul

description: Humanoid creatures of immense size and strength
name: Giant

description: Race of giants that fought the Olympian gods, sometimes depicted with snake-legs
name: Gigantes

description: a feared goat with wings that attack in packs of 25 to 700
name: goatogo dragon

description: Dog-sized ant that digs for gold in sandy areas
name: Gold-digging ant

description: Fanged, snake-haired humanoids that turn anyone who sees them into stone
name: Gorgon

description: An angel of death, often thought to be God's/Satan's assistant
name: Grim Reaper

description: A subclassification of angels that guard and protect a specific person or any living being
name: Guardian angel

description: Ghost that manifests as an old woman
name: Gui Po

description: Ghostly tree that confuses travelers by moving
name: Gui Shu

description: Demon fox with thousands of tails. Believed to possess an army of spirits and magic in its tails.
name: Gumiho

description: Wizened old woman, usually a malevolent spirit with this specific form, or a goddess in disguise
name: Hag

description: Talking beast which handed down knowledge on harmful spirits
name: Hakutaku

description: Hybrid of a human and an elf.
name: Half-elf

description: Spirit that protects a specific place
name: Haltija

description: Humanoid female with barbed, prehensile hair
name: Harionago

description: Death spirit with the form of a bird with a human head
name: Harpy

description: Undead who cannot leave its burial mound
name: Haugbui

description: Humanoid spirit who haunts or kills
name: Headless Horseman

description: Primordial giants with 100 hands and fifty heads
name: Hecatonchires

description: Crabs with human-faced shells, the spirits of the warriors killed in the Battle of Dan-no-ura
name: Heikegani

description: Hybrid of a griffin and horse, that is a lion-eagle-horse hybrid
name: Hippogriff

description: Ghosts of the newly dead, which take the form of fireballs
name: Hitodama

description: Part frog, part mammoth, part lizard, from Native American mythology
name: Hodag

description: Eagle-lion hybrid, similar to a griffin
name: Homa

description: Near passerine bird common to Africa and Eurasia that features in many mythologies in those continents
name: Hoopoe

description: Giant, who in eagle form, creates the wind by beating his wings
name: Hraesvelg

description: Frost Giants who are the main inhabitants of either Jotunheim or Niflheim
name: Hrímþursar

description: Thought and Memory; a pair of ravens associated with the Norse god Odin
name: Hugin and Munin

description: Snake whose poison causes the victim to swell up
name: Hydros

description: Snake from the Nile River that would kill crocodiles from the inside
name: Hydrus

description: Snake that kills its victims in their sleep
name: Hypnalis

description: Bird that changes color each time it finishes a song
name: Ibong Adarna

description: Can be considered a 'living ghost', as it is a person's spirit outside their body
name: Ikiryō

description: Sea serpent that travels over boats in an arc while dripping oil
name: Ikuchi

description: Flightless, dragon-like creatures (sometimes thought of as proto-dragons)
name: Imugi

description: Simple organisms, used by creator-gods to make everything else
name: Inapertwa

description: Horse-human hybrid, two-legged (as opposed to the four-legged centaur)
name: Ipotane

description: Savage human-goat hybrid from a remote island chain
name: Island Satyr

description: Ghostly aerial phenomenon that attacks people
name: Ittan-momen

description: Char which appeared as a Buddhist monk
name: Iwana-bōzu

description: Demi-god who has the form of a vulture
name: Jatayu

description: Demonic dragon that was given birth to by an American living in New Jersey
name: Jersey Devil

description: One-eyed, one-winged bird who requires a mate for survival
name: Jian

description: Spirit that protects a specific place
name: Jibakurei

description: Nine-headed bird worshiped by ancient natives in Hubei Province.
name: Jiufeng

description: Little people that live underground, in mushrooms, or as house spirits
name: Kabouter

description: Cat-like demon which descends from the sky and carries away corpses
name: Kasha

description: Kappa who climb into the mountains for the winter
name: Kashanbo

description: Woman riding on a flaming wheel
name: Katawa-guruma

description: Person possessed by a fox spirit
name: Kitsune-Tsuki

description: Woman who transformed into a serpent-demon out of the rage of unrequited love
name: Kiyohime

description: Little people and mine or house spirits
name: Kobold

description: Infant that cries until it is picked up, then increases its weight and crushes its victim
name: Konaki-Jijii

description: Vengeful ghost of a woman mutilated by her husband
name: Kuchisake-onna

description: Human-faced calf which predicts a calamity and then dies
name: Kudan

description: Jellyfish which floats through the air as a fireball
name: Kurage-no-hinotama

description: Second avatar of Vishnu in the form of a Turtle
name: Kurma

description: Little people that live underground, in mushrooms, or as house spirits
name: Kabouter

description: Karakoncolos (Bulgarian and Turkish), also in Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia known as Karanđoloz- Troublesome spirit
name: Karakoncolos

description: Cat-like demon which descends from the sky and carries away corpses
name: Kasha

description: Kappa who climb into the mountains for the winter
name: Kashanbo

description: Woman riding on a flaming wheel
name: Katawa-guruma

description: Person possessed by a fox spirit
name: Kitsune-Tsuki

description: Woman who transformed into a serpent-demon out of the rage of unrequited love
name: Kiyohime

description: Little people and mine or house spirits
name: Kobold

description: Infant that cries until it is picked up, then increases its weight and crushes its victim
name: Konaki-Jijii

description: Vengeful ghost of a woman mutilated by her husband
name: Kuchisake-onna

description: Human-faced calf which predicts a calamity and then dies
name: Kudan

description: Jellyfish which floats through the air as a fireball
name: Kurage-no-hinotama

description: Second avatar of Vishnu in the form of a Turtle
name: Kurma

description: Giant elephant that holds up the world
name: Maha-pudma

description: Vampires that sever their torsos from their legs to fly around
name: Manananggal

description: Little people with six fingers and no noses
name: Mannegishi

description: Attendant of Kiho-tumu, the supreme god
name: Mareikura

description: Jinn associated with open waters of the seas and oceans
name: Marid

description: Spirit that takes animal form; usually that of a black cat
name: Matagot

description: First Avatar of Vishnu in the form of a half-fish and half-man
name: Matsya

description: Female water spirit, with the form of a winged mermaid or serpent
name: Melusine

description: Combination of a lion and a fish, the symbol of Singapore
name: Merlion

description: Extremely elongated humanoid that has to live in rock crevasses to avoid blowing away
name: Mimi

description: One-horned stag-horse-elephant-boar hybrid, sometimes treated as distinct from the unicorn
name: Monocerus

description: Spirit of a deceased person seeking justice or has unfinished business
name: Multo

description: Nature and water spirits, serpentine or human-serpent hybrids
name: Nāga

description: Ritual disciplinary demon from the Oga Peninsula
name: Namahage

description: Giant catfish whose thrashing causing earthquakes
name: Namazu

description: Old woman who hides under the floor in abandoned storerooms
name: Nando-baba

description: Avatar of Vishnu in the form of half-man/half-lion
name: Narasimha

description: Half-human, half-demon creature with half a body
name: Nasnas

description: Little people that turn into coins
name: Negret

description: Cat in the form of a girl
name: Nekomusume

description: Gigantic sons of Grigori and human women
name: Nephilim

description: Monster which appears as a young woman and sucks all of the flesh off of its victim's body
name: Nikusui

description: Supernatural wall, also a monstrous flying squirrel
name: Nobusuma

description: Disembodied, flying head that attacks people
name: Nukekubi

description: Head-sized ball-like creature that floats in the sea and teases sailors
name: Nurarihyon

description: Female monster who appears on the beach
name: Nure-onna

description: Spirit that manifests as an impassable, invisible wall
name: Nurikabe

description: Spook which rides piggyback on a human victim and becomes unbearably heavy
name: Obariyon

description: God of Iron for the Yoruba people
name: Ogun

description: Ghost of a woman with a distorted face who was murdered by her husband
name: Oiwa

description: Spirit of a plate-counting servant girl, associated with the "Okiku-Mushi" worm
name: Okiku

description: Dog or wolf that follows travelers at night, similar to the Black dog of English folklore
name: Okuri-inu

description: Vampiric hag who takes the form of a fireball at night
name: Ole-Higue

description: Giant, human-eating centipede that lives in the mountains
name: Ōmukade

description: Large, grotesque humanoid demon, usual having red skin and horns
name: Oni

description: Bird-demon created from the spirits of freshly dead corpses
name: Onmoraki

description: Vengeful ghost that manifests in a physical rather than a spectral form
name: Onryō

description: Wild cat, possibly a subspecies of cougar
name: Onza

description: Lion-eagle hybrid, similar to a griffin, but with leonine forelimbs
name: Opinicus

description: Horse-headed, honest oracle classed as a demon
name: Orobas

description: God of the dead and the judge of the underworld
name: Osiris

description: Mystic serpent/dragon that eats its own tail
name: Ouroboros

description: Human-goat hybrids descended from the god Pan
name: Panes

description: Humanoid with giant ears, eight fingers and toes, and white hair
name: Pandi

description: Demons with herds of stolen cows
name: Panis

description: Shapeshifting animal whose natural form was a large ruminant
name: Parandrus

description: Fast, spotted feline believed to mate with lions to produce leopards
name: Pard

description: Giant race reputed to live in the area of Patagonia
name: Patagon

description: Vampires that sever their heads from their bodies to fly around, usually with their intestines or other internal organs trailing behind
name: Penanggalan

description: Nightmare demon in the form of a cat or dog
name: Pesanta

description: Ghost of a person who has died suddenly of a violent or cruel death in Thai folklore
name: Phi Tai Hong

description: Vampire created when a mother strangles her child
name: Plakavac

description: Undead, vampiric women who died in childbirth
name: Pontianak

description: Creatures, spirits, angels, or deities in many religions whose responsibility is to escort newly deceased souls from Earth to the afterlife
name: Psychopomp

description: Important god of the Aztec people; name meaning "feathered serpent", not to be confused with the quetzal, which is a type of bird
name: Quetzalcoatl

description: Spirit that protects a specific place
name: Rå

description: Eagle, sometimes depicted with two heads
name: Reichsadler

description: Skeletal creature with elements of a rabbit, badger, and bear
name: Rompo

description: Horse's head that dangles from trees on Kyūshū
name: Sagari

description: Shark-man servant of the dragon king of the sea.
name: Samebito

description: Nursery spirit that induces sleep in children
name: Sandman

description: King of Arts of Music, Dance and Entertainment in the Yoruba Culture
name: Sango

description: Spirits in a form of fireball, roaming around the forest
name: Santelmo

description: Wicked monkey spirit which was defeated by a dog
name: Sarugami

description: Human-horse hybrid and fertility spirit (human torso with the bottom half of a horse)
name: Satyr

description: Apes who always bear twins, one the mother loves, the other it hates
name: Satyrus

description: Human-snake-wolf hybrid with a snake's tail, twelve wolf legs, and six long-necked wolf heads
name: Scylla

description: Water spirit which can be heard making merry at night
name: Seko

description: Human-faced frog which guides the souls of the newly deceased to the graveyard
name: Senpoku-Kanpoku

description: Similar to Lucifer from the Bible
name: Shaitan

description: Protective spirit with the form of a winged bull or lion with a human head
name: Shedu

cultural_origins: English, Scottish and German, as schellenrocc
name: Shellycoat

description: Animated mosquito netting or dust cloth
name: Shirouneri

description: Creature that peers in through skylights
name: Shōkera

description: An animal mentioned in American folklore that is said to resemble a wolf or hyena
name: Shunka Warakin

description: Bald, fat, thick-lipped, and flat-nosed followers of Dionysus
name: Sileni

description: Dragon with aquiline hind legs and feline forelegs
name: Sirrush

description: Invisible spirit which pulls on sleeves
name: Sodehiki-kozō

description: Fiery ghost of an oil-stealing monk
name: Sōgenbi

description: Sound of trees being cut down, when later none seem to have been cut
name: Soraki-gaeshi

description: Vampiric hag who takes the form of a fireball at night
name: Soucouyant

description: Winged lion with a woman's head
name: Sphinx

description: Ugly and lonely creature capable of evading capture by dissolving itself into a pool of tears
name: Squonk

description: Humanoid whose males have enormous feet, and females have tiny feet
name: Struthopodes

description: Small dog- or cat-like creature that rubs against a person's legs at night
name: Sunekosuri

description: Japanese version of the Chinese Vermillion Bird
name: Suzaku

description: Unnatural strong horse, father of Sleipnir
name: Svaðilfari

description: Female spirit which can stretch itself to peer into the second story of a building
name: Taka-onna

description: Unharvested persimmon which becomes a monster
name: Tantankororin

description: Dragon with leonine, turtle, bear, and human attributes
name: Tarasque

description: Poltergeist that hits the tatami mats at night
name: Tatami-tataki

description: Ghost of a blind man, with his eyes on his hands
name: Te-no-me

description: Azerbaijani mythical creature similar to the cyclops Polyphemus
name: Tepegoz

description: Lion-eagle-scorpion hybrid made from the blood of murder victims
name: Terrible Monster

description: Asian fairy bluebird believed in as part of Philippine mythology
name: Tigmamanukan

description: Spirit that protects a specific place
name: Tipua

description: Demons that are formerly souls of dead unbaptized babies
name: Tiyanak

description: Spirit child carrying a block of tofu
name: Tōfu-kozō

description: Ghost who lurks in grade school restroom stalls
name: Toire-no-Hanakosan

description: A character in a story which exhibits a great degree of intellect or secret knowledge, and uses it to play tricks or otherwise disobey normal rules and conventional behaviour
name: Trickster

description: Inanimate object that becomes animated after existing for 100 years
name: Tsukumogami

description: Monster which drops or lowers a bucket from the top of a tree to catch people
name: Tsurube-otoshi

description: Giant falcon that helped shape the origins of the Magyars
name: Turul

description: Ghosts of women who died in childbirth
name: Ubume

description: Horse's leg which dangles from a tree and kicks passersby
name: Uma-no-ashi

description: Female sea monster who steals fish
name: Umi-nyōbō

description: Dead that behave as if alive
name: Undead

description: Spirit that shouts to surprise people
name: Uwan

description: Female spirit that leads souls of dead warriors to Valhalla
name: Valkyrie

description: Reanimated corpse that subsists on blood
name: Vampire

description: Third Avatar of Vishnu in the form of a boar
name: Varaha

description: Hawk sitting between the eyes of an eagle in the crown of Yggdrasill, the World Tree
name: Vedrfolnir

description: Ghost, shade, formed after a death of a human
name: Veļi

description: Dragon with breasts and an eagle's beak
name: Víbria

description: Rooster that sits atop the tree
name: Víðópnir

description: Demon in the form of a burning ox cart with a human head
name: Wanyūdō

description: Ghost of a murdered or mistreated woman
name: White Lady

description: Forest animal comprised from various animal parts (similar to a Chimera)
name: Wolpertinger

description: Flying reptile, usually with two legs and two wings
name: Wyvern

description: Mythical water people, with backwards heads and feet
name: Yacuruna

description: Demon who rides through the night on a headless horse
name: Yagyō-san

description: Antelope- or goat-like animal with swiveling horns
name: Yale

description: Either a dragon or a giant
name: Yilbegän

description: Mysterious bird that sings at night, sometimes indicating that the okuri-inu is near
name: Yosuzume

description: 100-year-old snake that transforms into a beautiful human
name: Yuxa

description: Mythical water people, with backwards heads and feet
name: Yacuruna

description: Demon who rides through the night on a headless horse
name: Yagyō-san

description: Antelope- or goat-like animal with swiveling horns
name: Yale

description: Either a dragon or a giant
name: Yilbegän

description: Mysterious bird that sings at night, sometimes indicating that the okuri-inu is near
name: Yosuzume

description: 100-year-old snake that transforms into a beautiful human
name: Yuxa
